I expected depressing a % for the chronic group.  The % actually looked pretty good :)  There is so much more info out there and sometime it's like going in circles.  Like eggs and wine, sometimes it good for you, then not, then is again, then....  HBV have all these possible correlations with various characteristics (e status, DNA, X protein, core mutations, s mutations, etc) and HCC and causation is still a big mystery.  Try not to worry about these things too much.  Know that as a chronic, we are at a higher risk for HCC and do monitor for it.  And monitor / treat with available means.  As we try to maximize our health and life, remember to live it and enjoy it as well :)
